item.title: (Show-Off) Gameframe & Maps - 317 Client
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:373063”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=469080.msg3430145#msg3430145 date=1292273307]

Can easily create a script inside of a 508 client to dump all decrypted maps with their respected object data + region. Then create a simple script to dump the code for the objects, and all models, not hard to do. Also, why are you showing this off if you followed someones tutorial for even a piece of this? The only time something is worth showing off, is when very few, or only you have it done.

Then do it

2 problems. My desktop needs a new graphics card, and my laptop does not have a strong enough processor. Let me get those fixed, and I will take you up on that. Ive done it before, all you do is dump the maps as they are loaded by the 508 client. I simply created a script to boost myself around to every area. Objects are easily done, since all you need to know is the file, and some basic 508 to 317 conversions for them. Models are a small bit trickier, as you need to find what method loads them, and then find where it decryptes them within the method, calling the dump to be done after the decryption.

1: you dont need a graphics card to dump the data, the 508 client works well with the lowest of graphics cards, even the ones that come default with a computer.
2: Models arent even encrypted with anything. l0l
3: dont say you can do something and then come up with an excuse as to why you cant do it.
[/quote]
1-You do need a graphics card to display a monitor with some desktops, not all mobo’s have a monitor plugin. 2-I was giving information, its been over a year since I have touched a client? 3-It’s not an excuse, for the fact i said i have done it, and its not that hard. I never said I would do it at first, until he asked me to. If you would like me to send you video’s of my desktop and laptop’s problems, i gladly will.

EDIT - There is a tutorial on R-S on how to dump the decrypted maps from a 508 client. Find that, and then write a script for bouncing to each region. Right there will get you all maps, and in correct places if you dump the correct information with them.[/quote]

Dump models by region, dump maps by region # loop, profit

Read full topic

item.title: (Show-Off) Gameframe & Maps - 317 Client
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:10, topic:373063”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=469080.msg3430097#msg3430097 date=1292270172]

Can easily create a script inside of a 508 client to dump all decrypted maps with their respected object data + region. Then create a simple script to dump the code for the objects, and all models, not hard to do. Also, why are you showing this off if you followed someones tutorial for even a piece of this? The only time something is worth showing off, is when very few, or only you have it done.

Then do it

2 problems. My desktop needs a new graphics card, and my laptop does not have a strong enough processor. Let me get those fixed, and I will take you up on that. Ive done it before, all you do is dump the maps as they are loaded by the 508 client. I simply created a script to boost myself around to every area. Objects are easily done, since all you need to know is the file, and some basic 508 to 317 conversions for them. Models are a small bit trickier, as you need to find what method loads them, and then find where it decryptes them within the method, calling the dump to be done after the decryption.
[/quote]

1: you dont need a graphics card to dump the data, the 508 client works well with the lowest of graphics cards, even the ones that come default with a computer.
2: Models arent even encrypted with anything. l0l
3: dont say you can do something and then come up with an excuse as to why you cant do it.[/quote]
1-You do need a graphics card to display a monitor with some desktops, not all mobo’s have a monitor plugin. 2-I was giving information, its been over a year since I have touched a client? 3-It’s not an excuse, for the fact i said i have done it, and its not that hard. I never said I would do it at first, until he asked me to. If you would like me to send you video’s of my desktop and laptop’s problems, i gladly will.

EDIT - There is a tutorial on R-S on how to dump the decrypted maps from a 508 client. Find that, and then write a script for bouncing to each region. Right there will get you all maps, and in correct places if you dump the correct information with them.

Read full topic
